text: Turkey will be competing at the 2020 Summer Paralympics in Tokyo, Japan from 24 August to 5 September, 2021. This will be the country's seventh appearance in the past eight Games despite their absence in the 1996 Summer Paralympics. ==Archery== Turkey have secured seven quotas in archery. ==Athletics== Two athletes are representing Turkey at the 2020 Summer Paralympics. ;Men's track {|class=wikitable style="font-size:95%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heats !colspan="3"|Final |- !Result !Rank !Result !Rank |- |Oguz Akbulut |Men's 400m T12 | | | | |} ;Women's track {|class=wikitable style="font-size:95%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heats !colspan="3"|Final |- !Result !Rank !Result !Rank |- |rowspan=2|Hamide Dogangun |Women's 400m T53 | | | | |- |Women's 800m T53 | | | | |} ==Goalball== Turkey have qualified in both the men's and women's teams. == Swimming == One swimmer will represent Turkey in swimming at the 2020 Summer Paralympics via the 2019 World Para Swimming Championships slot allocation method. ;Women {|class=wikitable style="font- size:95%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heats !colspan="2"|Final |- !Result !Rank !Result !Rank |- align=center |align=left|Sumeyye Boyaci |align=left|Women's 50m backstroke S5 | | | | |} == Table tennis == Abdullah Öztürk qualified to compete in table tennis at the 2020 Summer Paralympics. ==See also== *Turkey at the Paralympics *Turkey at the 2020 Summer Olympics ==References== Category:Nations at the 2020 Summer Paralympics Category:Turkey at the Paralympics Category:2021 in Turkish sport
title: Turkey at the 2020 Summer Paralympics
